thread.section_title: Finance - Crain's New York Business News Feed
thread.title: Pension fund contribution rates to drop, state comptroller says
thread.title_full: Pension fund contribution rates to drop, state comptroller says

author: Associated Press
title: Pension fund contribution rates to drop, state comptroller says
text:
Photo: Associated Press New York state Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli said pension fund contribution rates will drop. 
New York's comptroller says state and municipal contribution rates to the pension fund for public workers will drop again next year.Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli, trustee of the more than $180 billion fund, says the average rate will drop from 18.2% of salary to 15.5% in the fiscal year that starts next April.For police and firefighters, the rate will decline slightly from 24.7% of payroll to 24.3%.At the same time, the assumed rate of return for the retirement fund will be lowered from 7.5% to 7%. 
Mr. DiNapoli says lowering the return rate is "fiscally prudent" and "consistent with the tougher investment climate ahead.He says the payment rates are declining for the third straight year because of solid investment returns.
